sentence.Network_en: Britain did not introduce compulsory primary education until 1880.
sentence.Network_cn: 直到1880年，英国才开始实行初等义务教育。

sentence.Network_en: "Forgive my manners," she said calmly. "I neglected to introduce myself."
sentence.Network_cn: “请原谅我礼数不周，”她平静地说。“我忘了自我介绍了。”

sentence.Network_en: "And now, without further ado, let me introduce our benefactor."
sentence.Network_cn: “下面，闲话少说，让我来介绍一下我们的赞助人。”

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'bring (a person) into a place or group'): from Latin introducere, from intro- 'to the inside' + ducere 'to lead'

entry.def: To introduce something means to cause it to enter a place or exist in a system for the first time.

example.ex: The Government has introduced a number of other money-saving moves...
example.tran: 政府已经采取了其他一些省钱的举措。

example.ex: I kept the birds indoors all winter and introduced them into an aviary the following June...
example.tran: 整个冬天我把鸟关在室内,然后在接下来的6月份把它们放入鸟类饲养场饲养。

entry.tran: 介绍;使了解;使初次接触
entry.def: If you introduce someone to something, you cause them to learn about it or experience it for the first time.

example.ex: He introduced us to the delights of natural food.
example.tran: 他让我们认识到食用天然食物的乐趣。

entry.def: If you introduce one person to another, or you introduce two people, you tell them each other's names, so that they can get to know each other. If you introduce yourself to someone, you tell them your name.

example.ex: Tim, may I introduce you to my uncle's secretary, Mary Waller?...
example.tran: 蒂姆,我来介绍一下，这位是我叔叔的秘书玛丽·沃勒。

example.ex: Someone introduced us and I sat next to him...
example.tran: 有人给我们作了介绍,我挨着他坐下了。

entry.tran: 为(电视或广播节目)做开场白;主持
entry.def: The person who introduces a television or radio programme speaks at the beginning of it, and often between the different items in it, in order to explain what the programme or the items are about.

example.ex: 'Health Matters' is introduced by Dick Oliver on BBC World Service.
example.tran: 英国广播公司对外广播频道的“健康动态”节目由迪克·奥利弗主持。

means.word_mean: 1. cause to come to know personally;

sentences.sentence: "permit me to acquaint you with my son"
"introduce the new neighbors to the community"

means.word_mean: 2. bring something new to an environment;
4. bring in a new person or object into a familiar environment;

sentences.sentence: "The new secretary introduced a nasty rumor"

means.word_mean: 5. bring in or establish in a new place or environment;
7. bring before the public for the first time, as of an actor, song, etc.
8. as of legislation into a legislative body
9. furnish with a preface or introduction;

sentences.sentence: "She always precedes her lectures with a joke"
"He prefaced his lecture with a critical remark about the institution"
"The fall of the Berlin Wall ushered in the post-Cold War period"

Sentence.sentence: What it does mean is that the book business will go through a transformation in the next decade or so more profound than any it has seen since Gutenberg introduced printing from moveable type in the 1450s.
Albert Einstein predicted this in 1905, when he introduced the concept of relative time as part of his Special Theory of Relativity.

What kind of book is the speaker introducing?

sentences.cn: 请允许我自我介绍一下。

sentences.en: They shook hands all around and introduced one another.
sentences.cn: 他们一一握手, 互相介绍。

sentences.en: He introduced Mary as his daughter.
sentences.cn: 他介绍说玛丽是他女儿。

sentences.en: She introduced a suggestion that the committee should meet every week.
sentences.cn: 她提出了委员会每周碰头的建议。

sentences.en: Production is going up because we have introduced new techniques.
sentences.cn: 产量提高了, 因为我们采用了新技术。

sentences.en: A slow theme introduces the first movement.
sentences.cn: 第一乐章以缓慢的主旋律开始。

jushi.english: She introduced a suggestion that the committee should meet every week.
jushi.chinese: 她提了委员会每周碰头一次的建议。

jushi.english: Space science has introduced many new words.
jushi.chinese: 宇宙科学引进了许多新词汇。

jushi.english: I know your name, although we have never been introduced.
jushi.chinese: 我知道你的名字,尽管我们从未被介绍过。
